caption: In the small garden garden of Place Souham, located in the middle of the tall buildings, there is a fountain sculpture by Alberto Guzman. Made in 1983, this fountain is made up of truncated steel spheres. Two steel basins are supposed to let the water flow harmoniously, bringing magnificent bluish reflections to the sculpture! The only problem is that the water does not flow...(??...thanks to the City of Paris for remedying this!!) and the fountain seems a little abandoned, which is a shame for the work of this artist, born September 4, 1927 in Talara, Peru and died November 2, 20171, Parisian sculptor of Peruvian origin. Alongside his work as a sculptor, as evidenced by these monumental works for the city, as well as fountains, Alberto Guzm√°n created jewelry, furniture and theater sets....!
